title: The benefits to biodiversity of a strong circular economy - European Environment Agency
summary: This article discusses the potential of circular economy principles to mitigate biodiversity loss.  The authors argue that circular economy actions can reduce primary resource demand, prevent pollution, and promote biodiversity-friendly sourcing, ultimately contributing to a more sustainable production and consumption system.  They advocate for a biodiversity-inclusive circular economy that prioritizes regenerative practices and a holistic approach to resource management.

title: Five priorities for sustainable procurement in healthcare - Feature - Philips
summary: The article calls on European governments, purchasing agencies, and procurement organizations to improve supplier evaluation criteria for Green Public Procurement. It outlines five key themes for these criteria: reporting environmental impact and GHG reduction plans, focusing on circularity, requiring transparency on product performance and EcoDesign, demonstrating how digital offerings support decarbonization, and reporting social impact. By implementing these criteria, the healthcare industry can contribute to environmental sustainability goals.

title: A circular economy for critical minerals is fundamental for our future - Deloitte
summary: The UK government is focused on securing a sustainable supply of critical minerals, essential for low-carbon technologies. Their strategy includes adopting circularity principles to maximize mineral use, aligning with the goals of a circular economy. This involves minimizing waste, extending material lifespan, and designing for material recycling, all aiming to reduce reliance on virgin resources.

title: WCEF2023 Summary Report - Sitra
summary: The World Circular Economy Forum 2023 in Helsinki, Finland, brought together global leaders to discuss how to accelerate the transition to a circular economy. Key themes included collaboration, financing, and regenerating land through circular approaches. The forum highlighted the need for systemic change, local solutions, and prioritizing human well-being for a just and inclusive transition.

title: Seizing the Opportunity of E-Waste Recycling | BCG - BCG
summary: The article explores the challenges of e-waste collection and recycling, highlighting the lack of incentives for consumers and businesses to participate, high processing costs, and limited domestic capacity.  It proposes solutions including public sector interventions like extended producer responsibility laws and increased consumer education, as well as private sector initiatives like circular design principles, value-chain partnerships, and innovative business models that incentivize reuse and repair.

title: Design Shanghai to spotlight brands bridging east and west - Dezeen
summary: Design Shanghai, one of Asia's largest design events, returns for its 10th anniversary in June 2023.  The event will feature exhibitions, installations, a design forum, and networking events focusing on the meeting of eastern and western design philosophies.  This year's event highlights collaborations between Asian and European brands, new product launches, and installations that explore themes of weaving, disappearing borders, and the intersection of physical and digital worlds.

title: “Impact First” investment fund 'Transform Health Fund' will help to improve access to healthcare in Africa - Philips
summary: Philips has partnered with the Transform Health Fund to invest in healthcare infrastructure projects in developing countries. The fund aims to improve healthcare access and quality in these regions by investing in projects such as hospitals, clinics, and medical equipment. This initiative is a prime example of how private companies can play a crucial role in driving positive social and economic change.

title: Day One from 3 Days of Design in Copenhagen - Dezeen
summary: The 10th edition of 3 Days of Design in Copenhagen showcases a variety of innovations, including a new chair from House of Finn Juhl, a collection of fabrics by Inga Sempé and Kvadrat, and a tactile speaker design by GamFratesi for Bang & Olufsen. The festival also features exhibitions highlighting sustainable practices, such as Mater's What a Waste exhibition and Fredericia's B Corp certification.
